commit message: 0.8.x branch promoted to version 0.8.1, fixed list view of mail accounts not filling the main layout, made a bunch of private classes static

minor layout fixes, replace non breakable spaces if found in an encrypted armored message, as they break the decryption, the HTML representation of GMail introduces them for empty lines ending in a normal space, also adjusted the PGP_MESSAGE regex to allow for spaces after the -----, which seems to be added by some implementations
rewrote sign-only code, also finally recognize sign-only emails in the list and allow opening them for verification
lift branch 0.9.x's version to 0.9.0 and set version code to 5 for now
wrapped file dialogs into class in preparation for proper file picking
use OI File Manager intents to handle open/save file selection

major restructuring, moving dialog, message, menu, option menu, task, type IDs into Id in a similar structure as the generated R, also introducing a BaseActivity class that almost all activities derive from, which generates some common dialogs, handles the progress update, thread management, and thread communication

also adding first draft of encrypt file activity, not very functional yet
removed those files that should not have been included last revision *grunt*

set svn:ignore for bin directory and .project/.classpath

asymmetric file encryption working, some more cleanup, introduced an application directory to encrypt to by default
added file decryption, rewrote the various 'Choice' derivations to us the Id structure as well
layout adjustments, force portrait layout for EncryptFileActivity for now, (En|De)cryptFileActivity can now handle symmetric algorithms
swapped the buttons in main activity, reasoning that message encryption/decryption is more likely than file encryption, so they are at the bottom
clean up for release, AsciiArmour was a Button instead of CheckBox... fixed
bug prevents pass phrase being recognized, making key creation unusable
ElGamal support added, fix of some minor GUI bugs, added a bunch of safe primes for ElGamal key creation
choose the NEAREST prime for ElGamal, rather than the next lowest
set branch to next version, reset changelog
file encrypt layout entirely rewritten, should be much more userfriendly and work on more devices, changed message encrypt layout to match
add preferences, use them where applicable
put return values into the Id class as well, changed encrypt file layout to use symmetric OR asymmetric again, layout and string adjustments
only allow asymmetric encryption or symmetric encryption of files, not both like before
changed the option menu item order
recognize RSA_SIGN and RSA_ENCRYPT keys correctly, which fixes the hushmail problems

increased app version and cleared change log for 0.9.3
check whether the hashed packet is non-null before using it, also checking the unhashed ones in the same manner... not sure whether that's needed, but can't hurt? Fixes issue 17.

use buffers for encryption, so large files work as well... also showing encryption progress with better accuracy, which is especially useful for large encryptions

Fixes issue 18.
close streams more consistently (outside of encrypt/decrypt), force a new output filename guess if the ASCII armour checkbox state changes
give decryption a moving progress bar for a data of unknown size

added a service to handle the caching, this'll ensure the cache works while no activity is around, which is better for k9mail integration

it also is a more efficient and much smarter cache, not requiring an own timer thread, just a service that sleeps must of the time, it also is more accurate in cleaning up the entries, ensuring that the worst case of too late removal is 5 seconds

Update issue 56
Added a method for secure file deletion. We'll possibly have to test this a bit and make sure it actually *is* secure on the filesystems used (vfat for SD card, yaffs2 for phone flash memory by default). This sort of overwrite might be absolutely useless on some filesystems.
I also wanted to add an option at first, but this seems reasonably fast and in general it should be what the user wants, so for now it will ALWAYS securely delete. If there is a demand for plain deletion, then options can be added.

<!-- 'OI File Manager', 'ASTRO', and 'K-9 Mail' must NOT be translated in order for the links to the market to work. -->
<string name='text_help'>Install K-9 Mail for the best integration, it supports APG for PGP/INLINE and lets you directly encrypt/decrypt emails.
\n\nIt is recommended that you install OI File Manager or ASTRO to be able to use the browse button for file selection in APG.
\n\nFirst you need some keys. Either import them via the option menus in \'Manage Public Keys\' and \'Manage Secret Keys\' or create them in \'Manage Secret Keys\'.
\n\nYou can also add a GMail account in the main activity via \'Add Account\', which simplifies decrypting emails received there.
\n\nCheck out the option menus in the various activities to find more functions.
</string>

Add first basic implementation of Apgservice

Provides an AIDL-API for other apps to encrypt and decrypt a string
symmetrically with a passphrase. Function names and API is by no way

For reference and discussion see issue #71,
https://code.google.com/p/android-privacy-guard/issues/detail?id=71
Remove weird chars at the beginning of xml

Allow to regenerate shared preferences

I encountered a problem that changing preferences in APG did not change
the preferences in ApgService after it was called once:

1. call getPreferences
2. change settings in APG
3. call getPreferences again

--> the result at 3. was still having preferences from 1.

To work around this, the function getPreferences has been updated to
force the new generation of preferences while not breaking any other
code relying on the old behaviour.

Allow to regenerate shared preferences

completely around all input and output (if wanted).

Allow to pass large blobs and a new content provider to simplify this

Since AIDL is not for passing large data, a blob can be passed to APG by
a Uri. This Uri is opened as a file by APG and read/written to. Note the
file is overwritten by APG, so make sure it is a copy if you want to
keep the original.

With the ApgServiceBlobProvider, Apg has an own ContentProvider that can
be used like mentioned above. For now the data is stored in the dir
where APG stores other files and NOT DELETED after en/decryption. This
is tbd. It can only be accessed by an application with the permission
'org.thialfihar.android.apg.permission.STORE_BLOBS'.

ApgCon has been updated accordingly and can handle blobs with `setBlob`
and `getBlobResult`. That is a really easy way to en/decrypt large data.

Note that encrypting by blob should only be used for large files (1MB+).
On all other cases, the data should be passed as as String through the
AIDl-Interface, so no temporary file must be created.

See ApgCon for a complete example of how to connect to the AIDL and use
it. Or use it in your own project!

Reorder imports to conform to checkstyle config
Adjust variable/method naming to conform to style guide

Introduce Key/KeyRing wrappers

The goal of these classes is to greatly reduce the needed static helper
classes that work on BouncyCastle key ring and key objects.
Ideally only the pgp package uses BouncyCastle code, the rest of the
app should use this abstraction.

PublicKeyRing and SecretKeyRing exist only for cases where it is vital
that a specific kind of key ring is needed, for instance when it comes
to uploading to a key server, where a secret key ring must never be
used by accident.
Use hi-res version of the icon

Make PgpSignEncrypt use Key/KeyRing and PgpKeyProvider

This divorces the code from the app's content provider and removes
the need for PgpConversionHelper in parts of the code already.
Change PgpDecryptVerify to using PgpKeyProvider as well

Make Key serializable and use it for key editing

Also further reduce the usage of PgpKeyHelper and PgpConversionHelper.

Move key ring armoring into KeyRing, make code use it

Also remove PgpConversionHelper, as it isn't needed anymore.
Use KeyRing armor encoding in upload to server
Use libs/bc again, as it now builds spongycastle packages
Include all needed libraries as submodules

Don't include SDK info in AndroidManifest.xml

It's set in the gradle config now.

Fix Key serialization

The data returned by key.getEncoded() cannot be decoded on its
own by PGPObjectFactory. That'd require a key ring and with that
a master key.

The new serialization serializes the Key object and allows restoring
it accurately without creating a key ring as a workaround.

In PgpKeyOperation this requires adjusting the public key, as that
one is queried with isMasterKey(), and it is considered a master key
if subSigs == null. To avoid this, subSigs is initialized with an
empty ArrayList, resulting in a true subkey.
Make KeyRing.decode() deal with lack of key rings
Lift the plus button of user id sections

Remove the MainUserId selecting radio button

It clutters the UI a lot for a relatively minor feature that very
likely is rarely used. Main user IDs don't change often and when they
do, they can simply be changed in the first user ID entry.

In future it might be nice to allow reordering of the user IDs
with drag and drop, but that really doesn't seem like a necessary
feature right now.
Align key info in KeyEditor and adjust key ID display

Make emails optional in user IDs

This is allowed in the RFC and can be desired if a key shouldn't
be bound to an email at all.

Colorize fingerprint

Based on uberspot's 059e57c5d0b9192308d7d0ae036a731a038f5d6c,
using SHA1 as a hash function.

Fix really silly Color construction

Already having the red, green, blue values makes this much tidier.

Correct database upgrade

This will rebuild all database tables and fill them accordingly,
it also fixes the ranks of keys and user ids.

Fingerprints are left to do.
Adjust some scripts to install and run APG on the phone

Shift fingerprint colors into a visible brightness

If a color is too dark to be seen on black, then brighten it up to
a minimal brightness. If it is too light, then darken it to a
respective maximal brightness.

That way it'll be visible on black and white background without
any distracting background colour changes.
Join master key based on master key flag, not rank

Fix import of secret keys, correct Key.isSigningKey()

isSigningKey() now takes into account whether the private key is empty,
as that means the key cannot be used to sign.

Fix convertKeyIdToHex

The previous code would base the short representation on whether
the first 32 bit of the key ID would be greater than 0, which wasn't
the case for half the key IDs, as they'd result in a negative number.

Also introduce convertKeyIdToHexShort, which is used wherever it
makes sense to use the short (32bit) representation of key IDs.

Fix key list views in main key view

Since the views are being reused, a revoked key might set the text
color of a view and when the view is being reused for a non-revoked
key it is still red. So grab the default text colour and set it
explicitly when the key is not revoked.

Let convertKeyIdToHex handle short key IDs

If a short key ID is given, then it should only be displayed as such.
